input:
Give an overal comment for 'Task Achievement', 'Coherence & Cohesion', 'Lexical Resource', 'Grammatical Range & Accuracy' of this essay. The question is TASK 2

You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.
 
Some people believe that students' success in education depends primarily on their teachers, while others argue that it is the student’s own attitude and effort that play a more important role.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Write at least 250 words.. The student essay is: People like home. Home is good. Some countries, people think home is very good if they own it. Why? I think is because they can paint it. Rent home you cannot paint. My friend rent home and she want paint blue. But landlord say no! She is very sad. If you own home you can paint it blue or green or any color. This is why people like own home. Also, home is a place for family. Family is important. If you rent, maybe landlord say you cannot have children. Or you cannot have dog. But if you own home, you can have many children and many dogs! This is good for family. I think is good to own home. Is very positive. Because you can do what you want. You are the boss. No landlord. Landlords are mean. They take your money and say no to paint. Own home is better. You are happy and your family is happy and your dogs are happy. I like happy. Home is happy.

Please analysis and score on each term as 'Task Achievement', 'Coherence & Cohesion', 'Lexical Resource', 'Grammatical Range & Accuracy'. Items to be evaluated: The question is TASK 2

This is why people like own home. Also, home is a place for family. Family is important. If you rent, maybe landlord say you cannot have children. Or you cannot have dog. But if you own home, you can have many children and many dogs! This is good for family. I think is good to own home. Is very positive. Because you can do what you want. You are the boss. No landlord. Landlords are mean. They take your money and say no to paint. Own home is better. You are happy and your family is happy and your dogs are happy. I like happy. Home is happy.

You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.
 
Some argue that the rise of digital books has enhanced our reading habits, making literature more accessible to everyone. Others contend that the prevalence of e-books undermines the value of physical books and diminishes the reading experience.
Discuss both views and give your own opinion.

Write at least 250 words.. The student essay is: The bar chart show how much fertilizer used for four things in Australia, Japan and China. It is about 2020. The chart is showing wheat, rice, corn and soybeans. Australia use 120 for wheat and 140 for rice. Corn is 110 and soyabeans 100. Japan use 140 wheat, 170 rice, 150 corn, and 130 soyabeans. China, it use 100 for wheat. Rice is 110, corn is 105. And soyabeans is 95. So, Japan use more fertilizer than the other country. China use less fertilizer. Australia is in the middle. Rice is the most fertilizer use thing. And soyabeans is the less. The countries is different for the plants fertilizer use.

Some people believe that the government should be responsible for providing healthcare services free of charge, while others think individuals should pay for their own healthcare.

Discuss both views and give your own opinion.

They use fertilizer for wheat, rice, corn, and soybeans. Australia, they use blue for wheat. It about 120. Japan use green for rice, it is very high, maybe 170. China use orange for soybeans. It is the lowest, I think. It maybe 95. Fertilizer is important for grow food. The chart is about fertilizer. Country use it.

Give an overal comment for 'Task Achievement', 'Coherence & Cohesion', 'Lexical Resource', 'Grammatical Range & Accuracy' of this essay. The question is TASK 2

You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.
Many manufactured food and drink products contain high levels of sugar; which causes many health problems. Sugary products should be made more expensive to encourage people to consume less sugar.  
Do you agree or disagree?  
Write at least 250 words.. The student essay is: The diagrams show how the Southwest Airport is now and what it will be like after they change it. At the moment, the airport has security and passport control for people leaving the country, and also for people coming into the country. There is also customs for both. Passengers who want to leave go to departures and people who arrive from other contries go to arrivals. You can check in and drop your bags before you go. There is a cafe and an ATM to get money. You can get a sky train and hire a car. The walkway takes you to the gates. After the airport is redeveloped, there will be more. They are adding shops so you can buy things. I think it will be better because you can do more things while you wait for your plane. The security and passport control will still be there, but maybe bigger. It is going to look much nicer after. I hope it does not take too long. The changes are good for the airport because it will make more money. It will make people happy, too.

Give an overal comment for 'Task Achievement', 'Coherence & Cohesion', 'Lexical Resource', 'Grammatical Range & Accuracy' of this essay. The question is TASK 2

You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.
 
Modern technology is increasingly being used to monitor public spaces.
Why is this trend growing? Do you think the implications of this development are more positive or negative?

Write at least 250 words.. The student essay is: Some kids use their phones a lot every day. This is because phones are fun. I think it is bad. Phones have games. Kids like games. They play games on the phone for many hours. My brother does this. He plays all the time. My mother says stop it. But he doesn't listen. He likes the phone. It is easy to play games on the phone. You can play everywhere. School, home, bus. It is very easy. Phones also have youtube. Youtube is good for watching videos. Kids watch videos. They watch funny videos. They watch music videos. My sister watch videos all day. She doesn't do her homework. Phones is bad for homework. I think phones are bad for kids. Because kids don't play outside. They stay inside and play on the phone. This is not good for their health. They don't get exercise. They get fat. It is very bad. Also kids don't talk to each other. They just look at their phone. This is making them lonely. Phones is good for calling my mother. But playing games all day is wrong. Kids should not play on the phone all day. They should play outside and talk to friends. It is more better. Phones are bad for their brains and bodies.

You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.
 
Some people believe that the government should be responsible for providing healthcare services free of charge, while others think individuals should pay for their own healthcare.

Discuss both views and give your own opinion.

Write at least 250 words.. The student essay is: The diagrams show how the park change. It was different 20 years ago. Now it is modern. Before, the park had a path. This path went around a pond. There were also some benches for people to sit. And bushes were near the path. A lamp post was there too, for light at night. The park sign was there so people know it is a park. Some trash bin too. Now, the park has more things. There is a jogging track. People can run here. A drinking fountain is new. You can drink water from it. There is a public restroom too. Also, there is a kids playground. Kids can play here. The benches and bushes and pond are still there. The lamp post is still there too and the sign. The trash bins are also here. The park is better now because it has more things to do. Before it was just sitting. Now you can run and play. It is good for everyone. It changed from a simple park to a modern park. I like the new park more.

In many societies, there is a high significance placed on acquiring higher education.
Why do you think this is?
In your view, is this emphasis on higher education more advantageous or disadvantageous?

Write at least 250 words.. The student essay is: I think books is good. Some people like ebook and some people dont like ebook. I dont know what to say. Book is paper. Ebook is not paper. You can read book. You can read ebook. I like read. My mom like read. Ebook is on computer. Computer is internet. Internet is bad. Book is not internet. Book is good. Some people say ebook is easy. Easy to carry. Book is heavy. I dont like heavy. But book is good. I like the smell of book. Ebook dont have smell. So book is gooder. I like book.

Give an overal comment for 'Task Achievement', 'Coherence & Cohesion', 'Lexical Resource', 'Grammatical Range & Accuracy' of this essay. The question is TASK 2

You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.
 
In recent years, there has been a growing shift toward a cashless society, where people use digital payments instead of physical money.

What are the causes of this trend?

What impact could this have on individuals and society as a whole?

Give reasons for your answers and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Write at least 250 words.. The student essay is: Modern technology's increasing presence in monitoring public spaces is a multifaceted trend, driven by several interconnected factors. I believe that, on balance, while there are potential downsides, the positive implications outweigh the negative. One key reason for the growth of public space monitoring is the perceived enhancement of security. With rising concerns about crime and terrorism, governments and private entities alike are turning to surveillance technologies, like CCTV cameras and facial recognition software, to deter potential offenders and improve law enforcement's ability to respond to incidents more quicker. The argument is that these measures create a safer environment for citizens and businesses, encouraging economic activity and social interaction. Another factor is the technological advancements that have made monitoring more accessible and cost-effective. Cameras are now smaller, more powerful, and easier to install. Data storage is cheaper, and analytical software is more sophisticated, allowing for the automated processing of vast amounts of information. This has made widespread monitoring a feasible option for many communities and organisations. However, there are legitimate concerns about the implications of this development. One major issue is the potential for privacy violations. Constant surveillance can create a chilling effect on freedom of expression and assembly, as people may be hesitant to engage in activities if they know they are being watched. There's also the risk of data misuse or abuse, with personal information being collected, stored, and shared without proper consent or oversight. It is really important to have laws that protect us. Furthermore, some argue that increased surveillance can lead to a society of suspicion and distrust. When everyone is potentially a suspect, social cohesion can be eroded, and communities may become more fragmented. There is also the risk of bias and discrimination, as surveillance technologies can be used to target specific groups or individuals based on their ethnicity, religion, or political beliefs. In conclusion, the growing trend of monitoring public spaces is driven by a desire for enhanced security and facilitated by technological advancements. While there are valid concerns about privacy, data misuse, and social fragmentation, I believe that the potential benefits of increased safety and improved law enforcement outweigh the negative implications, provided that proper safeguards are put in place to protect individual rights and prevent abuse. These safeguards should include clear guidelines on data collection and storage, independent oversight of surveillance activities, and mechanisms for redress when privacy violations occur. Only then can we hope to strike a balance between security and freedom in the age of ubiquitous surveillance.

I think no. Why? Because is no good see people all time. I not do bad things, but I dont want people see me. It is like… um… no free. If police see you, maybe they think you do bad. Maybe they stop you and ask you things. This is no good. Also, the cameras cost money. The goverment pay. The goverment get money from people. So, we pay to be see all time. This is very bad. I think its bad more than good. It is only good for police. But no good for me and other people. We dont do bad things. Why watch us? I dont like. The technology is not good. Its bad. I stop now.

You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.
Some children spend hours every day on their smartphones.
Why is this the case? Do you think this is a positive or a negative development?
Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Write at least 250 words.. The student essay is: It is said that young people should study science more than art. Some people think it is good for the economy, but other people worry about culture. I think both are important, but science maybe more important now. On one hand, science and technology are very important for a country. If a country have good scientists, they can make new things and new inventions. These inventions can make the country rich. For example, China has become very rich because they have a lot of technology now. They can make phones and computers and sell them to other countries. Also, science can help us to solve problems like climate change. We need scientists to find new ways to make energy that doesn't hurt the earth. On the other hand, art is also important. Art make our life beautiful. Music and painting can make us happy. Also, art is part of our culture. If we don't study art, we might lose our culture. For example, traditional dances and songs are very important for some countries. If young people only study science, they might forget these things. In my opinion, science is more important at this time. The world have a lot of problems, and science can help us to solve them. However, we should not forget about art. We need to find a balance between science and art. Schools should teach both subjects. It is important for students to know about science, but it is also important for them to learn about art and culture. I think if we can do this, the world will be a better place for everyone, both in the economy and in culture also.

You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.
 
It is crucial for children to develop strong problem-solving skills from an early age. Some believe that fostering independence is the best way to encourage this, rather than providing constant guidance.

To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?

What strategies should parents and teachers adopt to promote independence in children?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
. The student essay is: The diagram comprehensively illustrates the sequential stages involved in the production of bricks, from the initial extraction of raw materials to the final delivery of the finished product. Overall, the process encompasses eleven distinct phases, beginning with excavation and culminating in transportation. Initially, the process commences with a digger excavating clay, the fundamental raw material. This clay is then combined with both sand and water, undergoing a process of flattening and compacting via a roller. Subsequently, the mixture is shaped; this is achieved either through the utilisation of a metal grid, a wire cutter, or a mould, depending on the desired brick dimensions. Following the shaping stage, the formed bricks are transferred to a drying oven. This crucial step removes moisture from the bricks, preparing them for the subsequent high-temperature firing. The bricks are then placed in a kiln, where they are fired at temperatures ranging from a moderate 200°C to a high 1300°C, depending on the specific type of brick being produced. Post-firing, the bricks undergo a carefully controlled cooling process within a designated cooling chamber to prevent cracking or structural weakness. Finally, once the cooling is complete, the bricks are meticulously packaged to ensure safe handling and transportation. The packaged bricks are then loaded onto a delivery truck, ready for distribution to their final destination within the building industry. Thus, from raw clay to packaged product, the diagram effectively portrays a comprehensive brick manufacturing methodology.

Thus, from raw clay to packaged product, the diagram effectively portrays a comprehensive brick manufacturing methodology.

You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.
 
As urban areas continue to expand, many people are moving away from rural communities. Some people believe that this trend is inevitable due to better opportunities in cities, while others argue that rural living offers a higher quality of life.

Discuss both views and give your own opinion.

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Write at least 250 words.. The student essay is: The pie charts provide a comparison of online sales across different retail sectors in Australia for the years 2013 and 2018. It’s clear to see how the distribution changed over the five-year period. In 2013, the largest sector for online sales was electronics and appliances, accounting for 35 percent. Food and beverage came in second with 25 percent, followed by home furnishings at 22 percent. Video games represented the smallest portion of online sales in that year, at 18 percent. Looking at the 2018 data, some notable shifts occurred. While electronics and appliances still remained a significant part of the online sales, its share decreased to 30 percent. Food and beverage also saw a small decrease, down to 23 percent. Home furnishings experienced a larger decrease, falling to 15 percent of the total. The biggest change was for video games, which jumped to 32 percent, making it the second largest sector in 2018. Overall, the online market in Australia showed a dynamic shift from 2013 to 2018. While electronics and appliances maintained a strong presence, video games experienced substantial growth, possibly driven by increased internet access and a younger demographic becoming more comfortable with online purchases. Its also possible people bought less things for the house and ordered more games.

Many people argue that schools should teach students practical life skills, such as managing finances and cooking, rather than focusing solely on traditional academic subjects.

What are the potential advantages of teaching life skills in schools?

Do you think this would better prepare students for adulthood?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Write at least 250 words.. The student essay is: The provided pie charts detail water consumption and subsequent wastage within a typical American household. The first chart illustrates the percentage of water used for different domestic activities, while the second highlights the percentage of water wasted in relation to those activities. Overall, showering accounts for the largest proportion of water usage, followed by toilet flushing. However, the wastage patterns are different, with toilet flushing contributing to the most significant portion of water wasted. As the initial chart shows, showering consumes 30% of household water, making it the highest single use. Toilet flushing follows closely behind at 25%. Laundry and outdoor use both account for 20%, while dishwashing and leaks only contribute 10% and 5% respectively. Turning to water wastage, we can observe a shift in proportions. Toilet flushing becomes the most significant source of waste, rising to 35%. Laundry also increases, comprising 30% of wasted water. Showering, while still a significant factor, decreases to 20% in terms of wastage. Dishwashing sees a marginal rise to 3%, while outdoor use remains constant at 10%. Interestingly, leaks, despite being a minor initial usage, accounts for only 2% of total water wastage. In conclusion, while showering is the largest use of water, inefficient toilet flushing practices contribute more significantly to water wastage within the average American household. These charts highlight the importance of addressing toilet flushing habits to reduce overall water waste.

You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.
In some countries, owning a home rather than renting one is very important for people.
Why might this be the case?
Do you think this is a positive or negative situation?
Write at least 250 words.. The student essay is: It is widely accepted that nurturing self-discipline and responsibility in children is very important from a young age. While both rewards and punishment have their place, I believe that rewards are generally a more effective strategy for encouraging positive behavior. This essay will explain why rewards are preferable and suggest some suitable rewards for parents and teachers to use. One reason why rewards work better is that they create a positive association with good behavior. Instead of associating good behavior with fear of punishment, children learn to associate it with positive feelings, such as pride or happiness. For example, if a child helps with chores and is praised for their help, they are more likely to repeat this behavior in the future. This positive reinforcement is more sustainable in the long run than punishment. Punishment, on the other hand, can often lead to negative consequences. Children may become resentful or develop a fear of making mistakes. It can also damage the relationship between the child and the adult administering the punishment. My younger brother, for example, was often punished for getting bad grades in school. This made him dislike school even more and he started to hide his grades from my parents. In the end, the punishment did not improve his academic performance. So, what kinds of rewards are most effective? For young children, simple verbal praise and small tangible rewards like stickers or extra playtime can work very well. As children get older, rewards can become more meaningful. This could include things like allowing them to choose a family activity, giving them more responsibility, or offering small monetary rewards for achieving specific goals. I remember when I was learning to play the piano, my parents promised me a new video game if I practiced every day for a month. This was a great motivation and I quickly improved my skills. Teachers can also use rewards effectively by giving extra credit for good work or by recognizing students' achievements in front of the class. In conclusion, while punishment may be necessary in some situations, I believe that rewards are a more effective approach to encouraging self-discipline and responsibility in children. They create a positive learning environment and help children develop a genuine desire to behave well. The key is to find rewards that are appropriate for the child's age and interests, and to use them consistently to reinforce positive behavior.

It is crucial for children to develop strong problem-solving skills from an early age. Some believe that fostering independence is the best way to encourage this, rather than providing constant guidance.

To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?

What strategies should parents and teachers adopt to promote independence in children?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
. The student essay is: The provided pie charts illustrate energy consumption and the corresponding energy wastage in a typical household. Overall, heating accounts for the largest proportion of both energy used and energy wasted, whilst other appliances represent the smallest percentages in both categories. Regarding energy consumption, heating dominates with a significant 40%, double that of water heating which constitutes 20%. Refrigeration accounts for 15% of the total energy consumption, closely followed by cooling and lighting, both at 10%. Other appliances consume the least energy, at only 5%. The picture changes slightly when considering energy wastage. Although heating remains the biggest culprit, accounting for fully 50% of all wasted energy, water heating is also substantial at 25%. Refrigeration contributes 10% to energy wastage. Comparatively, cooling and lighting account for only 5% and 8% respectively and the wastage of other appliances is the least significant at 2%. In summary, there’s a clear pattern where heating and, to a lesser extent, water heating, are the primary areas of energy use and, importantly, energy loss in a standard home. Addressing these two sectors would likely have the greatest impact on reducing overall energy consumption. It is important to remember that even seemingly small contributions, like lighting, contribute to the overall wastage and should not be ignored in conservation efforts.

Write at least 250 words.. The student essay is: It is true that problem solving is very important for children. If kids can’t solve problems, they will have a difficult life. Some people think that to let children be independent is the best. I agree with this idea mostly. If you always help children, they don't learn anything. For example, my brother he always asked my mother for help with his homework. He couldn’t do anything by himself. Now he is older, he still asks people for help all the time. This is not good because he need to be able to find answer on his own. One thing parents can do is to let children make their own choices. Even small things like what to wear or what to eat. This gives children confidence. They will think “I can decide this myself”. Also, if they make a bad choice, they will learn from their mistakes. Teachers also can help by giving children problems to solve in class that they need to do alone without help. But, I don’t think you can just leave children completely alone. Sometimes they need help and support. Parents and teachers should be there to guide them, but not do everything for them. It is like learning to ride a bicycle. You need someone to hold you at first, but then you need to try by yourself. In conclusion, independence is very important for children problem solving, but we still need to help them a little bit when they are young, then they can be great in the future.

With the increasing use of technology in the workplace, some people believe that automation will replace many traditional jobs in the future.

Write at least 250 words.. The student essay is: The two pie charts provide a comprehensive overview of the sources and consequences of environmental pollution. The first chart delineates the origins of pollutants, while the second illustrates the areas most profoundly impacted. As the data reveals, industrial waste constitutes the largest single source of environmental pollution, accounting for a substantial 40%. Transportation follows as the second major contributor, responsible for 25% of overall pollution. Agricultural activities contribute 15%, demonstrating a noteworthy impact. Deforestation and household waste are equal contributors, each representing 10% of the total pollution generated. Turning to the consequences, the pie chart illustrating affected areas shows that air quality is the most significantly impacted, with 35% of the pollution's effects manifesting in diminished air quality. Water bodies are also heavily affected, accounting for 30% of the total impact. Soil degradation represents a further significant consequence, affecting 20% of the environment. Wildlife habitats are impacted to a lesser extent at 10%, and oceans are the least affected, comprising only 5% of the areas damaged by pollution. In summary, the charts highlight that industrial processes are the foremost instigator of environmental pollution, with air quality and water bodies bearing the brunt of these detrimental effects. The disparity between the sources and the areas affected underscores the complex interconnectedness of environmental issues and the need for targeted mitigation strategies to address both the origins and the outcomes of pollution.

This is for social media. It goes up. People use social media more from January to December. The second line is green. This is for streaming. It is not so much up. It is like the same all year. The red line is for game. People play games more at the end of the year then at the begining. It start low and get high. The orange line is for shopping. It is like a straigt line. The purple line is for study. It go down a little bit. So, social media is the most popular. Shopping is the least popular. People like social media and game more at the end. Study and streaming are the same all the time. Shopping is always the same. I think people like internet.

You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.
 
Some people believe that advances in artificial intelligence (AI) will soon make many jobs obsolete, leading to widespread unemployment. Others argue that AI will create new opportunities for innovation and employment.

To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?

What long-term impacts do you think AI will have on society, and how should governments prepare for these changes?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Write at least 250 words.. The student essay is: In todays world, more and more people are move from the country to city. Some people think this is good because city have more job. Other people think that countryside is good for live. I will talk about both side and say what I think. On the one hand, city life have many advantage. The most important is job. In countryside, not many job available and people work on farm or small shop. But city have big company and factory. So people can find more job and earn more money. Also city have better education. University and good school is in the city. This is important for children future. On the other hand, countryside have a better life. Countryside is more quiet and less pollution. City is very noisy and crowded. Also countryside have fresh air and beautiful view. You can relax and enjoy nature. In the city, you just see building and traffic. Many people think this make them stress. In my opinion, I think both city and countryside have good thing. But for me, I like countryside better. I like quiet and nature. I don’t like the noise of city. If I have children, I want them to grow up in countryside. It is more healthy for them. Of course, city have good job, but money is not everything. Happy is more important.

You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.
In many countries, people are now living longer than ever before. Some people say an ageing population creates problems for governments. Other people think there are benefits if society has more elderly people.
To what extent do the advantages of having an ageing population outweigh the disadvantages?
Write at least 250 words.. The student essay is: In this days, many people use cards and phones to pay for things instead of money. I think it is because it is easy. You don't have to go to the ATM to get money. Also, some shops like if you pay with card because they don't have to give change. It's more safe too, because you cannot lose money if it is in the bank. This change have some bad things. One bad thing is that old people don't know how to use the cards. My grandmother, she doesn't understand how it works. So she have to always use money. It make it difficult for her. Another thing is that people maybe spend more money. Because you don't see the money leaving your hand, it's like it is not real. So you buy more things. It also change society. Shops that only take money will lose business. And banks will have more power. Maybe they can charge more fees because everyone need them. It is important to think about these things before the money is gone. I think money is important even if it is old.

You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.
 
It is essential for children to develop self-discipline and responsibility from an early age. Some argue that rewards are the most effective way to encourage good behavior, rather than punishment.

To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?

What forms of rewards should parents and teachers use to promote positive behavior in children?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Write at least 250 words.. The student essay is: The table illustrates the average weekly hours children aged 5-12 in four countries (USA, UK, Australia and Canada) spent on different activities in 2021. The activities are watching TV, playing video games, reading and outdoor activities. Overall, the data suggests that playing video games and watching TV consume the most time for children across all four countries, while reading receives the least amount of time. There are also interesting differences between the countries in terms of how they allocated time. Specifically, Australian children dedicate the most time to playing video games, averaging 18 hours per week, closely followed by children in the USA at 15 hours. The UK and Canada are slightly lower, with 12 and 14 hours respectively. Regarding television viewing, the UK sees the highest average at 12 hours, while Australia shows the lowest, at 8 hours. USA and Canada both fall somewhere in the middle. In terms of reading, children in Canada spend the most time reading (7 hours), followed by the UK (6 hours). Australia record the lowest average for reading, at just 4 hours per week, while the USA children spend only 5 hours. Finally, outdoor activities occupy a relatively similar amount of time across all the countries, ranging from 6 hours in Canada to 9 hours in Australia. It's interesting to note that although Australia spends the least time watching tv and reading, it’s children spend more time playing video games and being outdoors than others.

You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.
 
It is argued that young individuals should be encouraged to pursue careers in science and technology rather than in the arts. Some believe this is essential for economic development, while others think that it could lead to a loss of cultural identity.

Examine both sides of this argument and provide your own perspective.

Support your viewpoint with reasons and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
. The student essay is: The table shows the average hours children spend each week on different activities in four countries in 2021. The activities are Watching TV, Playing Video games, Reading and Outdoor Activities. The countries included are the USA, UK, Australia, and Canada. Overall, playing video games consumes more time than other activities among children in the four countries. Reading occupies the least amount of time. In the USA, kids spend the most time playing video games, at 15 hours per week, followed by watching TV at 10 hours. Reading gets only 5 hours, and outdoor activities get 7 hours. The UK has a more balanced distribution, with watching TV and video games both being around 12 hours. Reading is at 6 hours and outdoor play at 8 hours. Australian children dedicate the most time to video games which is 18 hours per week, which is the highest among the four countries. Watching TV is the lowest with only 8 hours a week . Reading is also low, at only 4 hours, and outdoor activities take up 9 hours. Canadian children like playing video game also, around 14 hours each week, and watching tv around 9 hours. They read a little bit more than the others, at 7 hours, but do outdoor activities less, only 6 hours a week. In conclusion, video games are the most popular activity across all four countries, and reading is the least common. Australia kids plays more video games than others.
